intro: Lobelia rubrimaris, commonly known as the redstem lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and wetlands. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Lobelia rubrimaris is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
